inline: sudo bash masterPrep.sh "${azurerm_storage_account.persistent_volume_storage_account.name}" "${var.admin_username}" && sudo bash deployOpenShift.sh "${var.admin_username}" "${var.openshift_password}" "${var.key_vault_secret}" "${var.openshift_cluster_prefix}-master" "${azurerm_public_ip.openshift_master_pip.fqdn}" "${azurerm_public_ip.openshift_master_pip.ip_address}" "${var.openshift_cluster_prefix}-infra" "${var.openshift_cluster_prefix}-node" "${var.node_instance_count}" "${var.infra_instance_count}" "${var.master_instance_count}" "${var.default_sub_domain_type}" "${azurerm_storage_account.registry_storage_account.name}" "${azurerm_storage_account.registry_storage_account.primary_access_key}" "${var.tenant_id}" "${var.subscription_id}" "${var.aad_client_id}" "${var.aad_client_secret}" "${azurerm_resource_group.rg.name}" "${azurerm_resource_group.rg.location}" "${var.key_vault_name}"

definition.description: Number of OpenShift Masters nodes to deploy. 1 is non HA and 3 is for HA.
Number of OpenShift infra nodes to deploy. 1 is non HA.  Choose 2 or 3 for HA.
Number of OpenShift nodes to deploy. Allowed values: 1-30
Cluster Prefix used to configure domain name label and hostnames for all nodes - master, infra and nodes. Between 1 and 20 characters
Location of the azure resource group.
Name of the azure resource group in which you will deploy this template.
This is the storage account Tier that you will need based on the vm size that you choose (value constraints)
This is the storage account Tier to create. Possible values include Standard and Premium.
Admin username for both OS login and OpenShift login

Size of the Bastion Virtual Machine. Allowed values: Standard_A4, Standard_A5, Standard_A6, Standard_A7, Standard_A8, Standard_A9, Standard_A10, Standard_A11, Standard_D1, Standard_D2, Standard_D3, Standard_D4, Standard_D11, Standard_D12, Standard_D13, Standard_D14, Standard_D1_v2, Standard_D2_v2, Standard_D3_v2, Standard_D4_v2, Standard_D5_v2, Standard_D11_v2, Standard_D12_v2, Standard_D13_v2, Standard_D14_v2, Standard_G1, Standard_G2, Standard_G3, Standard_G4, Standard_G5, Standard_D1_v2, Standard_DS2, Standard_DS3, Standard_DS4, Standard_DS11, Standard_DS12, Standard_DS13, Standard_DS14, Standard_DS1_v2, Standard_DS2_v2, Standard_DS3_v2, Standard_DS4_v2, Standard_DS5_v2, Standard_DS11_v2, Standard_DS12_v2, Standard_DS13_v2, Standard_DS14_v2, Standard_GS1, Standard_GS2, Standard_GS3, Standard_GS4, Standard_GS5
Password for OpenShift login
Select from CentOS (centos) or RHEL (rhel) for the Operating System
os image map
Path to your SSH Public Key
Path to the private ssh key used to connect to machines within the OpenShift cluster.
Size of data disk to attach to nodes for Docker volume - valid sizes are 128 GB, 512 GB and 1023 GB

Size of the Infra Virtual Machine. Allowed values: Standard_A4, Standard_A5, Standard_A6, Standard_A7, Standard_A8, Standard_A9, Standard_A10, Standard_A11,Standard_D1, Standard_D2, Standard_D3, Standard_D4,Standard_D11, Standard_D12, Standard_D13, Standard_D14,Standard_D1_v2, Standard_D2_v2, Standard_D3_v2, Standard_D4_v2, Standard_D5_v2,Standard_D11_v2, Standard_D12_v2, Standard_D13_v2, Standard_D14_v2,Standard_G1, Standard_G2, Standard_G3, Standard_G4, Standard_G5,Standard_D1_v2, Standard_DS2, Standard_DS3, Standard_DS4,Standard_DS11, Standard_DS12, Standard_DS13, Standard_DS14,Standard_DS1_v2, Standard_DS2_v2, Standard_DS3_v2, Standard_DS4_v2, Standard_DS5_v2,Standard_DS11_v2, Standard_DS12_v2, Standard_DS13_v2, Standard_DS14_v2,Standard_GS1, Standard_GS2, Standard_GS3, Standard_GS4, Standard_GS5
Local path to openshift scripts to prep nodes and install openshift origin
This will either be 'xipio' (if you don't have your own domain) or 'custom' if you have your own domain that you would like to use for routing
The name of the Key Vault you will use
The Secret Name you used when creating the Secret (that contains the Private Key)

Size of the Master Virtual Machine. Allowed values: Standard_A4, Standard_A5, Standard_A6, Standard_A7, Standard_A8, Standard_A9, Standard_A10, Standard_A11, Standard_D1, Standard_D2, Standard_D3, Standard_D4, Standard_D11, Standard_D12, Standard_D13, Standard_D14, Standard_D1_v2, Standard_D2_v2, Standard_D3_v2, Standard_D4_v2, Standard_D5_v2, Standard_D11_v2, Standard_D12_v2, Standard_D13_v2, Standard_D14_v2, Standard_G1, Standard_G2, Standard_G3, Standard_G4, Standard_G5, Standard_D1_v2, Standard_DS2, Standard_DS3, Standard_DS4, Standard_DS11, Standard_DS12, Standard_DS13, Standard_DS14, Standard_DS1_v2, Standard_DS2_v2, Standard_DS3_v2, Standard_DS4_v2, Standard_DS5_v2, Standard_DS11_v2, Standard_DS12_v2, Standard_DS13_v2, Standard_DS14_v2, Standard_GS1, Standard_GS2, Standard_GS3, Standard_GS4, Standard_GS5

Size of the Node Virtual Machine. Allowed values: Standard_A4, Standard_A5, Standard_A6, Standard_A7, Standard_A8, Standard_A9, Standard_A10, Standard_A11, Standard_D1, Standard_D2, Standard_D3, Standard_D4, Standard_D11, Standard_D12, Standard_D13, Standard_D14, Standard_D1_v2, Standard_D2_v2, Standard_D3_v2, Standard_D4_v2, Standard_D5_v2, Standard_D11_v2, Standard_D12_v2, Standard_D13_v2, Standard_D14_v2, Standard_G1, Standard_G2, Standard_G3, Standard_G4, Standard_G5, Standard_D1_v2, Standard_DS2, Standard_DS3, Standard_DS4, Standard_DS11, Standard_DS12, Standard_DS13, Standard_DS14, Standard_DS1_v2, Standard_DS2_v2, Standard_DS3_v2, Standard_DS4_v2, Standard_DS5_v2, Standard_DS11_v2, Standard_DS12_v2, Standard_DS13_v2, Standard_DS14_v2, Standard_GS1, Standard_GS2, Standard_GS3, Standard_GS4, Standard_GS5
The wildcard DNS name you would like to use for routing if you selected 'custom' above. If you selected 'xipio' above, then this field will be ignored
storage os disk size
The name of the Resource Group that contains the Key Vault
Azure Active Directory Client ID also known as Application ID for Service Principal
Azure Active Directory Client Secret for Service Principal
Subscription ID of the key vault
Tenant ID with access to your key vault and subscription
